<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Consists
of our Executive Stock Incentive Plan and our All Share Stock Option Plan. See
Note 5 to our Consolidated Financial Statements for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005, included in Item 8 of this Report, for additional information regarding
these plans.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="SalesOfUnregisteredSecurities_080908"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales of Unregistered Securities</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the quarter ended December&nbsp;31,
2005, we discovered that we had issued an aggregate of 2,329,606 shares
of&nbsp;common stock to certain of our employees participating in our Employee
Stock Purchase Plan. After giving effect to stock splits occurring on June&nbsp;8,
1998 and December&nbsp;15, 2000, the number of shares of common stock which we
were authorized to sell under our Employee Stock Purchase Plan, and with
respect to which we had filed a Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;S-8,
was 2,000,000. Accordingly, we concluded that the issuance of 329,606 shares of
our common stock was not registered under the Act.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">28</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='28',FILE='C:\fc\7315271444_D10496_919396\2947-1-di.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 15:27 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Of the shares sold in excess
of the Employee Stock Purchase Plan&#146;s authorized limit, 154,126 shares were
sold on January&nbsp;4, 2005 at a price of $14.35 per share and 175,480 shares
were sold on July&nbsp;5, 2005 at a price of $15.45 per share. Pursuant to the
provisions of the Employee Stock Purchase Plan, the amounts paid by the
participating employees for the shares were withheld as payroll deductions from
compensation we would have otherwise paid to such employees during the
six-month period preceding the month of each sale.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><a name="Item6_SelectedFinancialAndOperati_192728"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ITEM 6.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>SELECTED
FINANCIAL AND OPERATING DATA</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following selected
financial and operating data of should be read in conjunction with &#147;Management&#146;s
Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations,&#148; and
our consolidated financial statements and related notes included elsewhere in
this Report.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="SelectedConsolidatedFinancialData_192731"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Selected

</table>

</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Calculated
by dividing net income by the average of beginning and ending stockholders&#146;
equity for the year.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>On
September&nbsp;7, 2005, we completed the acquisition of ASA from Delta for
$421.3 million in cash. We paid $5.3 million of transaction fees and ASA
assumed approximately $1.25 billion in long-term debt and related assets. Our
2005 consolidated operating revenues contain 114 days of additional revenue
generated by the ASA acquisition.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">29</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\fc\7315271444_D10496_919396\2947-1-di.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 15:27 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="SelectedOperatingData_080910"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Selected Operating
Data</font></b></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr>
  <td width="211" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:158.55pt;"><a name="QuarterlyFinancialData_080911"></a>
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="361" colspan="9" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:270.5pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Year
  Ended December&nbsp;31,</font></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="211" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:158.55pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Number of operating
  aircraft at end of year</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="52" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:39.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">59,016</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.55pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="52" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:39.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">60,197</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">58,933</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</table>

</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>On
September&nbsp;7, 2005, we completed the acquisition of ASA and our fourth
quarter&#160; operating revenues contain 114
days of additional revenue generated by the ASA acquisition.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following terms used
in this section and elsewhere in this Report have the meanings indicated below:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;Revenue passenger miles&#148;
represents the number of miles flown by revenue passengers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;Available seat miles&#148;
represents the number of seats available for passengers multiplied by the
number of miles the seats are flown.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;Load factor&#148; represents
the percentage of aircraft seating capacity that is actually utilized (revenue
passenger miles divided by available seat miles).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;Breakeven load factor&#148; is
the passenger load factor that will result in operating revenues being equal to
operating expenses, assuming constant revenue per passenger mile and expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;Yield per passenger mile&#148;
represents the average amount one passenger pays to fly one mile.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;Passenger revenue per
available seat mile&#148; represents passenger revenue divided by available seat
miles.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 3.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;Operating cost per
available seat mile&#148; represents operating expenses plus interest divided by
available seat miles.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">30</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\fc\7315271444_D10496_919396\2947-1-di.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 15:27 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 47.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-47.0pt;"><a name="Item7_ManagementsDiscussionAndAna_141609"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:uppercase;">Item 7.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;text-transform:uppercase;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="text-transform:uppercase;">Management&#146;s
Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following discussion and analysis presents factors
that had a material effect on our results of operations during the years ended December&nbsp;31,
2005, 2004 and 2003. Also discussed is our financial position as of the end of December&nbsp;31,
2005 and 2004. You should read this discussion in conjunction with our
consolidated financial statements, including the notes thereto, appearing
elsewhere in this report or incorporated herein by reference. This discussion
and analysis contains forward-looking statements. Please refer to the sections
of this Report entitled &#145;&#145;Cautionary Statement Concerning Forward-Looking
Statements&#146;&#146; and &#147;Item 1A. Risk Factors&#148; for discussion of the uncertainties,
risks and assumptions associated with these statements.</font></i></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="Overview_075957"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Overview</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Through SkyWest Airlines and ASA, we operate the
largest regional airline in the United States. As of December&nbsp;31, 2005,
SkyWest Airlines and ASA offered scheduled passenger and air freight service
with more than 2,400 total daily departures to 218 destinations in the United
States, Canada, Mexico and the Caribbean. Additionally, we provide ground
handling services for approximately ten other airlines throughout our system. As
of December&nbsp;31, 2005, our consolidated fleet consisted of 229 CRJ200s (66
assigned to United and 163 assigned to Delta, including ten CRJ100s which have
been upgraded to conform to the manufacturer&#146;s specifications for CRJ200s) 77
CRJ700s (42 assigned to United and 35 assigned to Delta), 62 Brasilia
turboprops (48 assigned to United and 14 assigned to Delta), and 12 ATR-72
turboprops (all assigned to Delta). We believes our success in attracting
multiple contractual relationships with major airline partners is attributable
to our delivery of high-quality customer service with an all cabin-class fleet
at a competitive cost structure. For the month ended December&nbsp;31, 2005,
approximately 59.9% of our aggregate capacity was operated under the Delta code
and approximately 40.1% was operated under the United code.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SkyWest Airlines has been a partner with Delta in Salt
Lake City and United in Los Angeles since 1987 and 1997, respectively. In 1998,
SkyWest Airlines expanded its relationship with United to provide service in
Portland, Seattle/Tacoma, San Francisco and additional Los Angeles markets. In
2001, SkyWest Airlines expanded its operations to serve as the Delta Connection
in Dallas/Fort Worth. However, effective January&nbsp;31, 2005, SkyWest
Airlines re-deployed all its Delta Connection flights to Salt Lake City as a
result of Delta&#146;s decision to &#147;de-hub&#148; its Dallas/Fort Worth operations. In
2004, SkyWest Airlines expanded its United Express operations to provide
service in Chicago. As of December&nbsp;31, 2005, SkyWest Airlines operated as
a Delta Connection carrier in Salt Lake City, and a United Express carrier in
Los Angeles, San Francisco, Denver, Chicago and the Pacific Northwest,
operating more than 1,500 total daily flights. &#160;In April&nbsp;2003, SkyWest Airlines signed an
agreement with Continental to supply Continental with regional airline feed
into Continental&#146;s Houston hub beginning on July&nbsp;1, 2003. The Continental
flying represented only approximately 1.5% of our &#147;available seat miles&#148; or &#147;ASMs&#148;
during 2004, and generated less than 1.0% of our 2005 operating income. In January&nbsp;2005,
we announced the mutual decision with Continental to end SkyWest Airlines&#146;
operations as a Continental Connection carrier and we completed the phase-out
process on July&nbsp;1, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;7, 2005, we completed the
acquisition of ASA from Delta for $421.3 million in cash. Additionally, as part
of the purchase, we paid $5.3 million of transaction fees and ASA assumed
approximately $1.25 billion in long-term debt. In addition, we returned to
Delta $50 million in deposits that Delta had previously paid on future ASA
aircraft deliveries. We believe the combination of SkyWest Airlines and ASA
presents our company with new opportunities for growth through our two
geographically-focused regional airline platforms&#151;SkyWest Airlines in the
Western United States and ASA in the Eastern United States. We now provide the
vast majority of regional airline service for Delta in Atlanta, its most
important eastern hub, and Salt Lake City, its most important western hub. In
connection with the ASA acquisition, we have established new, separate, but
substantially similar, long-term fixed-fee </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">31</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\fc\731505625_D10496_919035\2947-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 15:01 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Delta Connection
Agreements with Delta for both SkyWest Airlines and ASA. We also obtained
control of 26 gates in the Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport located in
Atlanta, from which we currently provide service to Delta. Delta has committed
to provide to us opportunities to utilize 28 additional regional jets in our
fleet by the end of 2007. Delta has also agreed that, starting in 2008, ASA is
guaranteed to maintain its percentage of total Delta Connection flights that it
has in 2007, so long as its bid for additional regional flying is competitive
with other regional carriers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ASA has been a code-share partner with Delta in
Atlanta since 1984. ASA expanded its operations as a Delta Connection carrier
to also include Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky and Salt Lake City in September&nbsp;2002
and April&nbsp;2003, respectively. ASA operates approximately 850 daily
flights, all in the Delta Connection system.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Historically, multiple contractual relationships have
enabled us to reduce reliance on any single major airline code and to enhance
and stabilize operating results through a mix of our controlled or &#147;pro-rate&#148;
flying and contract flying. On contract routes, the major airline partner
controls scheduling, ticketing, pricing and seat inventories and we are
compensated by the major airline partner at contracted rates based on the
completed block hours, flight departures and other operating measures. On
pro-rate flights, we control scheduling, ticketing, pricing and seat
inventories and receive a pro-rated portion of passenger fares. Since August&nbsp;1,
2003, substantially all of our flights have been contract flights. For the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, essentially all of our Brasilia turboprops flown
for Delta were flown under pro-rate arrangements while approximately 92% of our
Brasilia turboprops flown in the United system were flown under contractual
arrangements, with the remaining nine percent flown under pro-rate
arrangements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2005, Delta filed for reorganization
under Chapter 11 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code.&nbsp;Prior to the date of Delta&#146;s
bankruptcy filing, each of SkyWest Airlines and ASA entered into an amended
Delta Connection Agreement which provides for a 15-year term, subject to
certain termination and extension rights. Delta received all necessary
approvals from the U.S. Bankruptcy Court and the Delta Connection Agreements
were assumed by Delta on October&nbsp;6, 2005. Under the terms of its Delta
Connection Agreement, SkyWest Airlines is compensated primarily on a
fee-per-completed-block hour and departure basis, is reimbursed for fuel and
other direct costs, and is paid a margin based on completed block hours. Under its
Delta Connection Agreement, ASA is compensated primarily on a
fee-per-completed-block-hour basis, is directly reimbursed for fuel and other
costs, and is paid a margin based on performance incentives. Notwithstanding
the assumption by Delta of the Delta Connection Agreements, Delta&#146;s bankruptcy
filing could still lead to many other unforeseen expenses, risks and
uncertainties for SkyWest Airlines, ASA or both.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Although Delta has reported that it intends to
reorganize and emerge from its ongoing Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceeding, it
could convert its reorganization proceeding to a liquidation proceeding under
the U.S. Bankruptcy Code or liquidate some or all of its assets through one or
more transactions with third parties. Such events could jeopardize our Delta
Connection operations, leave us unable to efficiently utilize the additional
aircraft which we are currently obligated to purchase, or result in other
outcomes which could have a material adverse effect on our operating results or
financial condition.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Although a plan of reorganization has been confirmed
in United&#146;s bankruptcy proceedings, which became effective on February&nbsp;1,
2006 (subject to pending appeals), there is no assurance that United&#146;s plan
will ultimately succeed. Among other uncertainties, United&#146;s order of
confirmation is subject to pending appeals. There is no assurance that United
will be able to operate successfully under the terms of its plan. In the event
United is not able to perform successfully under the terms of its plan, our United
Express operations could be jeopardized, which could have a material adverse
effect on our operating results or financial condition.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On February&nbsp;4, 2005,
we announced that SkyWest had been selected by United to operate 20 new CRJ700s
in its United Express operations, and that SkyWest had placed a firm order for
these CRJ700s </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">32</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\fc\731505625_D10496_919035\2947-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 15:01 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">with
Bombardier. Deliveries of these aircraft began in the third quarter of 2005 and
we expect these deliveries to be completed by the first quarter of 2006. Our
total firm aircraft orders and commitments, as of December&nbsp;31, 2005,
consisted of orders for <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">15 CRJ700s, 17
CRJ900s</font> and commitments to lease six CRJ200&#146;s from Delta. Total
expenditures for these aircraft and related flight equipment, including amounts
for contractual price escalations is estimated to be approximately $838 million
through April&nbsp;2007. Additionally, our agreement with Bombardier includes
options for another 70 aircraft that can be delivered in either 70 or 90-seat
configurations. We presently anticipate that delivery dates for these aircraft
could start in January&nbsp;2007 and continue through April&nbsp;2010; however,
actual delivery dates remain subject to final determination as agreed upon by
us and our code-share partners.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="CriticalAccountingPolicies_075958"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Critical Accounting Policies</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our significant accounting
policies are summarized in Note 1 to our consolidated financial statements for
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, included in Item 8 of this Report. <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Critical accounting policies are those policies
that are most important to the preparation of our consolidated financial
statements and require management&#146;s subjective and complex judgments due to the
need to make estimates about the effect of matters that are inherently
uncertain. Our critical accounting policies relate to revenue recognition,
aircraft maintenance, aircraft leases and impairment of long-lived assets and
intangibles as discussed below. The application of these accounting policies
involves the exercise of judgment and the use of assumptions as to future
uncertainties and, as a result, actual results will differ, and could differ
materially from such estimates.</font></font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenue Recognition</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Passenger and ground
handling revenues are recognized when service is provided. Under our contract
and pro-rate flying agreements with our code-share partners, revenue is
considered earned when the flight is completed. In the event that our
contractual rates have not been finalized at quarterly or annual financial
statement dates, we record revenues based on a prior period&#146;s approved rates,
adjusted to reflect management&#146;s current estimate of the results of the
then-current contract negotiations. Our agreements with our code-share partners
contain certain provisions pursuant to which the parties could terminate the
respective agreements, subject to certain rights of the other party, if certain
performance criteria are not maintained. Our revenues could be impacted by a
number of factors, including changes to the code-share agreements, contract
modifications resulting from contract renegotiations and our ability to earn
incentive payments contemplated under applicable agreements.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Maintenance</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We use the direct-expense
method of accounting for our regional jet aircraft engine overhaul costs. Under
this method, the maintenance liability is not recorded until the maintenance
services are performed, thus substantially reducing significant estimates and
judgments inherent under the accrual method. We use the &#147;deferral method&#148; of
accounting for our Brasilia turboprop engine overhauls, which provides for
engine overhaul costs to be capitalized and depreciated over the estimated
useful life of the engine. For leased aircraft, we are subject to lease return
provisions that require a minimum portion of the &#147;life&#148; of an overhaul be
remaining on the engine at the lease return date. With respect to engine
overhauls related to leased Brasilia turboprops to be returned, we adjust the
estimated useful lives of the final engine overhauls based on the respective
lease return dates. With respect to SkyWest Airlines, a third-party
vendor provides our long-term engine services covering the scheduled and
unscheduled repairs for engines on our CRJ700s. Under the terms of the
agreement, we pay a set dollar amount per engine hour flown on a monthly basis
and the third-party vendor assumes the obligation to repair the engines at no
additional cost to us, subject to certain specified exclusions.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">33</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\fc\731505625_D10496_919035\2947-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 15:01 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft Leases</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The majority of SkyWest
Airlines&#146; aircraft are leased from third parties, while ASA&#146;s aircraft are
primarily debt-financed on a long-term basis. In order to determine the proper
classification of our leased aircraft as either operating leases or capital
leases, we must make certain estimates at the inception of the lease relating
to the economic useful life and the fair value of an asset as well as select an
appropriate discount rate to be used in discounting future lease payments.
These estimates are utilized by management in making computations as required
by existing accounting standards that determine whether the lease is classified
as an operating lease or a capital lease. All of our aircraft leases have been
classified as operating leases, which results in rental payments being charged
to expense over the terms of the related leases. Additionally, operating leases
are not reflected in our condensed consolidated balance sheet and accordingly,
neither a lease asset nor an obligation for future lease payments is reflected
in our condensed consolidated balance sheet.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Impairment of
Long-Lived and Intangible Assets</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31,
2005, we had approximately $2.6 billion of property and equipment and related
assets. Additionally, as of December&nbsp;31, 2005, we had approximately $33.0
million in intangible assets. In accounting for these long-lived and intangible
assets, we make estimates about the expected useful lives of the assets, the
expected residual values of certain of these assets, and the potential for
impairment based on the fair value of the assets and the cash flows they
generate. We recorded an intangible of approximately $33.0 million relating to
the acquisition of ASA. The intangiblel is being amortized over fifteen years
under the strait-line method. As of December&nbsp;31, 2005, we had recorded
$718,000 in amortization expense. Factors indicating potential impairment
include, but are not limited to, significant decreases in the market value of
the long-lived assets, a significant change in the condition of the long-lived
assets and operating cash flow losses associated with the use of the long-lived
assets. On a periodic basis, we evaluate whether the book value of our aircraft
is impaired in accordance with SFAS No.&nbsp;144, &#147;Accounting for the
Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets.&#148;&nbsp; Based on the results of the
evaluations, our management concluded no impairment was necessary as of December&nbsp;31,
2005. However, there is inherent risk in estimating the future cash flows used
in the impairment test. If cash flows do not materialize as estimated, there is
a risk the impairment charges recognized to date may be inaccurate, or further
impairment charges may be necessary in the future.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="ResultsOfOperations_080000"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Results of Operations</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="a2005ComparedTo2004_080000"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2005 Compared to 2004</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating Statistics.</font></i></font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></i>The following table sets forth our major operational
statistics and the percentage-of-change for the years identified below.</p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr>
  <td width="273" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:204.9pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="205" colspan="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:153.7pt;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="273" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:204.9pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cost per available seat
  mile</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.6</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.7</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="273" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:204.9pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fuel cost per available
  seat mile</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">39.4</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="273" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:204.9pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Average passenger trip length (miles)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">469</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">413</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">34</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\fc\731505625_D10496_919035\2947-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 15:01 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our total ASMs generated during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005 increased 68.5% from the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. The increase
in ASMs was primarily a result of increasing the size of our aircraft fleet,
including our acquisition of ASA, from 206 aircraft as of December&nbsp;31,
2004, to 380 aircraft as of December&nbsp;31, 2005. On the date we acquired
ASA, ASA&#146;s fleet consisted of 149 aircraft (35 CRJ700s, 102 CRJ200s and 12
ATRs). In addition to the aircraft acquired in connection with the acquisition
of ASA, we took delivery of 30 CRJ 700s and two CRJ200s during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
Income.</font></i></font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></i>Net
income increased to $112.3 million, or $1.90 per diluted share, for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, compared to $81.9 million, or $1.40 per diluted
share, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. Factors relating to the
change in net income are discussed below.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating revenues increased 69.9% for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005, compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. The increase in total
operating revenues was primarily due to the acquisition of ASA. Airline
operating and interest expenses, excluding fuel charges, per ASM decreased 7.8%
to 9.5&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, from 10.3&#162; for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. The primary reason for the decrease was the
increased capacity of our regional jet aircraft and the increase in stage
lengths flown by our regional jet aircraft.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Passenger
Revenues.</font></i></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; Passenger revenues, which represented
98.7% of consolidated operating revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005, increased 70.1% to $1.94 billion for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005, from $1.14 billion, or 98.6% of consolidated operating revenues, for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. Our passenger revenues, excluding fuel
reimbursements from major partners, increased 51.9% for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005. The increase in passenger revenues excluding fuel was primarily due to a
68.5% increase in ASMs, principally as a result of our increase in operating
aircraft to 380 aircraft as of December&nbsp;31, 2005, from 206 aircraft as of December&nbsp;31,
2004. Revenue per ASM increased 0.7% to 15.4&#162;, from 15.3&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2004, primarily due to an increase in fuel reimbursements from our major
partners. Passenger revenues include an amount designed to reimburse us for
aircraft ownership costs. The amount deemed to be rental income for the year
ended 2005 was $308.3 million.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Passenger
Load Factor.</font></i></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; Passenger load factor increased to
75.0% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, from 73.5% for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2004. The increase in load factor was due primarily to the
further development of our relationships with United and Delta whereby SkyWest
supplements mainline service in previously established and developed markets.
Additionally, we are experiencing higher passenger acceptance of our regional
jet aircraft.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ground
Handling and Other Revenue.</font></i></font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></i>Total
ground handling revenue for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 increased
approximately 55.5% from the same period of 2004. The increase was primarily
related to contracts with our major partners, whereby, SkyWest performs the
ground handling for other regional airlines.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total
Airline Expenses Excluding Fuel.</font></i></font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></i>Total
airline expenses for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, excluding fuel
charges (which are substantially reimbursable by our major partners), increased
approximately 55.2% from the same period of 2004. The increase was primarily a
result of a 68.5% increase in ASMs (which resulted principally from the
acquisition of ASA). Total operating expenses for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2005 increased at a lower rate than ASM growth, primarily due
to the increased operating efficiencies obtained from increased stage lengths
flown by the regional jets.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">35</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\fc\731505625_D10496_919035\2947-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 15:01 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating
and Interest Expenses.</font></i></font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></i>Operating
and interest expenses increased 74.5% to $1.80 billion for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2005, compared to $1.03 billion for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2004. The increase in total operating and interest expenses
was due principally to the acquisition of ASA. As a percentage of consolidated
operating revenues, total operating and interest expenses increased to 91.5%
for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, from 89.1% for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2004. The increase in operating and interest expenses as a
percentage of consolidated operating revenues was primarily due to significant
increases in fuel costs year-over-year.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following tables set forth information regarding our operating expense
components for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 and 2004. Operating
expenses are expressed as a percentage of operating revenues. Individual
expense components are also expressed as cents per ASM.</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.2pt;">
  <p style="line-height:12.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The cost per ASM of salaries, wages and employee
benefits decreased to 3.4&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, compared
to 3.8&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. The average number of full-time
equivalent employees increased 97.2% to 13,304 for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005 from 6,747 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. The increase in
number of employees was due, in large part, to the acquisition of ASA and
addition of personnel required for the new regional jet flying and ground
handling operations within our United Express operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The cost per ASM for aircraft costs, including
aircraft rent and depreciation, decreased to 2.6&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005, from 3.0&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. The decrease in cost
per ASM was primarily due to the addition of ASA&#146;s regional jet fleet and the
addition of thirty CRJ700s, which have a lower operating cost per ASM than our
existing CRJ200 and turboprop fleets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The cost per ASM for maintenance expense remained
constant at 1.0&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, and December&nbsp;31,
2004. Under our United Express Agreement, specific amounts are included in the
rates and charges for mature maintenance on regional jet engines that we record
as revenue. However, consistent with the change to a direct expense maintenance
policy, we record maintenance expense on our CRJ200 engines as it is incurred. As
a result, during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, we collected and
recorded as revenue $25.2 million (pretax) under the United Express Agreement,
with no material offset to CRJ200 engine maintenance overhauls. Because the &#147;Maintenance&#148;
line in the table set forth above does not include salaries, wages and employee
benefits associated with our maintenance operations (those costs are stated
separately in the table), the maintenance expense line in the above table
differs from the maintenance line in our Condensed Consolidated Statements of
Income set forth in Item 8 below.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The cost per ASM for fuel increased 39.4% to 4.6&#162; for
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, from 3.3&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2004. This increase was primarily due to the average price of fuel </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">36</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='36',FILE='C:\fc\731516210_D10496_919035\2947-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 15:01 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">increasing to $2.05 per
gallon during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, from $1.45 per gallon for
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The cost per ASM for other expenses, primarily
consisting of landing fees, station rentals, computer reservation system fees
and hull and liability insurance, decreased 8.7% to 2.1&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2005, from 2.3&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. The decrease was
primarily related to the increase in stage lengths flown by our regional jets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest expense increased
to approximately $53.3 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005,
from approximately $18.2 million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. The
increase in interest expense was primarily due to the acquisition of ASA&#146;s
aircraft which are primarily financed with long-term debt.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="a2004ComparedTo2003_084027"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2004 Compared to 2003</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating Statistics.</font></i></font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></i>The following table sets forth our major operational
statistics and the percentage-of-change for the years identified below.</p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">

  available seat mile</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.30</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.50</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="273" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:204.9pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Average passenger trip
  length (miles)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">413</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="62" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:46.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">393</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.05pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The total ASMs we generated during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2004 increased 28.4% from the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003. The increase
in ASMs was primarily a result of the increase in our operating aircraft to 206
aircraft as of December&nbsp;31, 2004, from 185 aircraft as of December&nbsp;31,
2003. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, we took delivery of 12 new
CRJ200s, four used CRJ200s with an average age of less than one year and 12 new
CRJ700s.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
Income.</font></i></font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></i>Net
income increased to $81.9 million, or $1.40 per diluted share, for the year
ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, compared to $66.8 million, or $1.15 per diluted
share, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003. Factors relating to the
change in net income are discussed below.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Passenger
Revenues.</font></i></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; Passenger revenues include an amount
designed to reimburse us for aircraft ownership cost. The amount deemed to be
rental income for the year ended 2004 was $187.0 million. Passenger revenues,
which represented 98.6% of consolidated operating revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2004, increased 29.2% to $1.14 billion for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2004, from $882.1 million, or 99.3% of consolidated operating revenues, for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003. Passenger revenues, excluding fuel
reimbursements from major partners, increased 21.1% for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2004. The increase in passenger revenues excluding fuel was primarily due to a
28.4% increase in ASMs, principally as a result of us increasing our operating
aircraft to 206 aircraft as of December&nbsp;31, 2004, from 185 aircraft as of December&nbsp;31,
2003; however, this increase was partially offset by the economic efficiencies
of flying new, incremental regional jet aircraft. These efficiencies are passed
on to our major partners through the rates contemplated by their respective
contracts. Twelve CRJ700s and twelve additional CRJ200s were placed into
service under our United Express operations during the </p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">37</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='37',FILE='C:\fc\731516210_D10496_919035\2947-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 15:01 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">year ended December&nbsp;31,
2004. Revenue per ASM increased 1.3% to 15.3&#162;, from 15.1&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2003, primarily due to an increase in fuel reimbursements from major partners.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Passenger
Load Factor.</font></i></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; Passenger load factor increased to
73.5% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, from 71.9% for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2003. The increase in load factor was due primarily to the further development
of our relationships with United and Delta whereby SkyWest supplements mainline
service in previously established and developed markets. Additionally, we are
experiencing higher passenger acceptance of our regional jet aircraft.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total
Airline Expenses Excluding Fuel.</font></i></font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></i>Total
airline expenses for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, excluding fuel
charges (which are substantially reimbursable by our major partners), increased
approximately 21.4% from the same period of 2003. The increase was primarily a
result of a 28.4% increase in ASMs (which resulted principally from the
expansion of SkyWest&#146;s regional jet fleet from 2003). Total operating expenses
for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004 increased at a lower rate than ASM
growth, primarily due to the increased operating efficiencies obtained from
increased stage lengths flown by the regional jets.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating
and Interest Expenses.</font></i></font><i><font style="font-style:italic;">&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></i>Operating
and interest expenses increased 30.4% to $1.03 billion for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2004, compared to $789.4 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003. The
increase in total operating and interest expenses was due principally to the
growth in our regional jet fleet from 2003. As a percentage of consolidated
operating revenues, total operating and interest expenses increased to 89.1%
for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, from 88.9% for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2003. The increase in operating and interest expenses as a percentage of
consolidated operating revenues was primarily due to significant increases in
fuel costs year-over-year.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating revenues increased 30.2% for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2004, compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, while total operating
and interest expenses increased 30.4% over the same period. The increase in
total operating revenues was primarily due to the growth in SkyWest&#146;s regional
jet fleet from 2003. Airline operating and interest expenses, excluding fuel
charges, per ASM decreased 5.5% to 10.3&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2004, from 10.9&#162; for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003. The primary reason
for the decrease was the increased capacity of our regional jet aircraft and
the increase in stage lengths flown by our regional jet aircraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following tables set forth information regarding our operating expense
components for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2004 and 2003. Operating
expenses are expressed as a percentage of operating revenues. Individual
expense components are also expressed as cents per ASM.</font></p>

<div align="center">

  <td width="70" colspan="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:52.2pt;">

  <td width="193" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:144.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total airline

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.95pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="55" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,029,508</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.85pt;">

  </td>
